title: Moelis underwrites $100m Primewest float
text:
While Latitude Financial Group's run at the ASX boards grabs the headlines, investors have voted with their feet at property play Primewest Group.

Stockbroker Moelis has underwritten the company's $100 million initial public offering for a deal that will see the group list with a $349.1 million market capitalisation on November 8.

Property manager Primewest Group will list with a $349.1 million market capitalisation on November 8. Ryan Stuart

Moelis' move comes after it and co-manager Shaw and Partners ran a bookbuild last week, and obviously had some success. A prospectus for the offer landed with the corporate regulator on Monday.

Primewest is an Australian real estate funds management business that was founded in 1995 and manages $3.9 billion of assets across 75 funds and seven asset classes.

The deal valued the company at 10.5 times 2020 financial year adjusted EBITDA and implied a 5 per cent forecast 2020 annualised distribution yield.
description: While Latitude's run at the ASX-boards grabs the headlines, investors have voted with their feet at Primewest Group.
